table.name: mem
table.column: The verb {SuD:v:0} means both "be green" and "take a risk". Also, Starfleet "redshirts" are infamous for dying.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was spoken by Kruge to Valkris. The reason that he used {lI':v:2} while she used {lab:v} seems to be because they're on opposite ends of the transmission, but it's not exactly clear when each verb would be the right one to use.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a command given to a data transceiving device ({HablI':n}).
Команда отдается устройству для передачи данных ({HablI':n}).

The subtitle says "Ready to transmit", which was the original English line spoken by the actress playing Valkris. However, the Klingon is phrased as a command, so "Prepare to transmit" is a better translation.

table.name: mem
table.column: Kruge says this to the gunner, who accidentally destroys the USS Grissom. Later, upon encountering the USS Enterprise, he tells the gunner's replacement, {baHwI', DoS yIbuS. QuQ neH.:sen:nolink} This latter sentence is more emphatic (see {buS:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: هیچ چیز در اینجا اتفاق نمی افتد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Il ne se passe rien ici. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: من می خواستم زندانیان را بگیرم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
我要俘虜他們的。（我想捕捉戰俘。）

This sentence was one of the most significant in the development of the Klingon language. It was originally supposed to mean "I told you, engines only." It was changed in the subtitles to say "I wanted prisoners." This led to the invention of the plural suffix for beings {-pu':n}, the accomplishment suffix {-ta':v}, the verbs {jon:v} and {neH:v}, and the idea of clipped Klingon which was needed to explain their lack of any prefix, the rule that the second verb in a sentence-as-object construction never takes an aspect suffix, as well as a change in the meaning of the verb {ma':v} to mean "accommodate" (its original meaning being assigned to the new verb {ja':v}). Furthermore, {QuQ:n} was changed from a verb meaning "to disable" to a noun meaning "engine" for the line, {baHwI', DoS yIbuS. QuQ neH.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: notlh veS, 'a tugh manotlhchoH je maH.
War is obsolete, as we are in danger of becoming.
Der Krieg ist überholt, aber wir werden bald auch überholt sein.
جنگ منسوخ است، زیرا ما در معرض خطر تبدیل شدن هستیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kriget är föråldrat, eftersom vi riskerar att bli. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Война устарела, мы скоро будем в опасности
戰爭已經過時了，但我們面臨著危險的處境。
A guerra é obsoleta, mas corremos o risco de nos tornar.
Sotiminen ei ole nykyaikaa, kuten emme pian mekään.
La guerre est obsolète, comme nous risquons de le devenir. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The first part of this sentence, {notlh veS:sen:nolink}, appears on {KGT p.47:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Sie haben uns ohne Zweifel ausgetrickst!

table.name: mem
table.column: What's she doing? (Why is she going there?)
او چه کار می کند؟ (چرا او به آنجا می رود؟) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vad gör hon? (Varför går hon dit?) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
她在幹什麼？（她為什麼要去那裡？）
O que ela está fazendo? (Por que ela está indo para lá?)
Qu'est ce qu'elle fait? (Pourquoi va-t-elle là-bas ?) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Here, "she" refers to the Enterprise ({'entepray':n:name}). Chang ({cheng:n:name}) was expressing puzzlement about the movement of the Enterprise.
The subtitle was "What's she doing?" but a more literal translation is "Why is she going there?"

В данном случае "Она" относится к Энтерпрайзу ({'entepray':n:name}). Ченг ({cheng:n:name}) выражал замешательство о маневре Энтерпрайза (финальный эпизод полнометражного фильма Звёздный путь 6:Неоткрытая страна. прим.перев).
В субтитрах значилось "Что она делает?" но более дословный перевод "Почему она идёт туда?"

table.name: mem
table.column: ما گرانش را گم کرده ایم! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: I am here to help you.
Ich bin hier, um Ihnen zu helfen.
من اینجام تا شما را یاری کنم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag är här för att hjälpa dig. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Voin auttaa sinua. Olen täällä sitä varten.
Je suis ici pour vous aider. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This literally means "I can be helpful. I'm traveling on a mission."
This was a lip-match for {DevwI' ghaH 'Iv'e'?@@DevwI':n, ghaH:n, 'Iv:ques:1h, -'e':n:suff} "Who is the leader?"

table.name: mem
table.column: ghach jIvvo' naH. DaH pIghvamDaq So''eghtaH.
There is a criminal hiding in these ruins.
In diesen Ruinen versteckt sich ein Terrorist.
در این ویرانه ها یک مخفی جنایی وجود دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det finns en brottsling som gömmer sig i dessa ruiner. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Есть преступник, что прячется в этих развалинах.
Há um criminoso escondido nessas ruínas.
Julma rikollinen väijyy. Hän piileskelee näissä raunioissa.
Un criminel se cache dans ces ruines. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The first half of this sentence was a lip-match for the beginning of {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.
The German subtitles, and apparently an earlier version of the English subtitles, use "terrorist" to translate {jIvvo':n} instead of "criminal".

table.name: mem
table.column: Qob lIb bam SoH chuDlI' je.
You and your people are in danger.
Du und deine Leute sind in Gefahr.
شما و افرادتان در معرض خطر هستید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du och ditt folk är i fara. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы и ваши люди в опасности. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
您和您的人民處於危險之中。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você e seu povo estão em perigo.
Sinä ja väkesi olette välittömässä vaarassa.
Vous et votre peuple êtes en danger. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The expected prefix on {bam:v} is {bo-:v:pref}, since the subject is plural and second-person. However, occasionally and under certain circumstances, in a sentence with a compound second- and third-person subject, a non-prefixed verb is used. There is scant evidence that this usage is becoming more widespread in casual speech, and perhaps Uhura was speaking informally or idiomatically. This sentence shouldn't be taken as textbook Klingon, but might be an example of colloquial Klingon.[2]
Possibly {bo-:v:pref} was mixed up with {lI-:v:pref} during filming or editing, which forced {lIb:v} to be created.

table.name: mem
table.column: 克魯格指揮官的緊急信息。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Mensagem urgente para o Comandante Kruge.
Message urgent pour le commandant Kruge. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

برای یادگیری مختصات پیدایش سیاره، با نماینده ما صحبت کنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Чтобы узнать координаты Genesis Planet, поговорите с нашим агентом. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
要了解Genesis Planet的坐標，請與我們的代理商聯繫。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Para aprender as coordenadas do Planeta Gênesis, fale com nosso agente.
Jos haluat saada selville Genesis-planeetan koordinaatit, puhu agentillemme.
Pour connaître les coordonnées de Genesis Planet, parlez à notre agent. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the {HoD:n} of a starship named {'entepray':n:name}.
In Klingon, titles generally go after the name.
The name {'archer:n:name,nolink} has been heard spoken in Klingon, but has not appeared in written canon.

table.name: mem
table.column: Captain Archer and his crew are honorable people.
Captain Archer und seine Crew sind ehrenwerte Leute.
کاپیتان آرچر و خدمه اش مردم شریف هستند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kapten Archer och hans besättning är hedervärda. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Капитан Арчер и его команда - достойные люди. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
阿切爾船長和他的船員都是光榮的人。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O capitão Archer e sua tripulação são pessoas honradas.
Kapteeni Archer ja hänen miehistönsä ovat kunniallisia ihmisiä.
Le capitaine Archer et son équipage sont des personnes honorables. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Let them continue on their way.
اجازه دهید آنها در راه خود ادامه دهند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: I have nothing to say to you, human.
Ich habe dir nichts zu sagen, Mensch.

Minulla ei olla mitään sanottavaa sinulle, ihminen.
Je n'ai rien à te dire, humain. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.column: I demand to see the magistrate!

table.column: Minha sentença de morte foi comutada!

table.column: What do you want with me?

Qu'est-ce que tu veux avec moi? [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This literally means "Why do you (plural) want me?"
To address a single person, say {qatlh choneH?:sen@@qatlh:ques, cho-:v, neH:v}

table.column: This can also mean "Secure her!" or "Secure it!"
Dies kann auch bedeuten "Sichern Sie sie!" oder "Sichern Sie es!"

بازگشت به سایت حمل و نقل [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ghIq chalDaq HovDaq SIq qeylIS 'ej jatlh pa' DaqHomvetlh wovDaq HInej.
Then Kahless pointed to a star in the sky and said, "Look for me there, on that point of light."
Dann zeigte Kahless auf einen Stern am Himmel und sagte: "Bringe mich an diesen hellen Ort hier oben."
سپس Kahless به یک ستاره در آسمان اشاره کرد و گفت: "به دنبال من در آن نقطه از نور است." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Då pekade Kahless på en stjärna på himlen och sa: "Leta efter mig där, på den punkten av ljuset." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Затем Кахлесс указал на звезду в небе и сказал: «Ищите меня там, в этой точке света». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
然後「凱勒斯」指著天空中的一顆星說：「在那個光點上尋找我。」
Então Kahless apontou para uma estrela no céu e disse: "Procure-me lá, naquele ponto da luz".
Sitten Kahless osoitti tähteä taivaalla ja sanoi: "Etsikää minua tuolta valopisteeltä."
Puis Kahless désigna une étoile dans le ciel et dit : "Cherchez-moi là, sur ce point lumineux." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is part of the Story of the Promise, which tells of the departure (and prophesies the return) of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}.
Det här är en del av berättelsen Historien om löftet, som berättar om {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} avfärd (och profeserar om hans återkomst).

The Klingon text comes from an inscription seen on one of the {DSC:src} trailers, while the English translation is from {TNG - Rightful Heir:src}.
Set photos show that this sentence is preceded by {Suto'vo'qor vIjaH 'ach 'opleS jIchegh 'e' vIlay'.:sen@@Suto'vo'qor:n, vI-:v, jaH:v, 'ach:conj, 'opleS:n, jI-:v, chegh:v, 'e':n, vI-:v, lay':v}

table.name: mem
table.column: The Klingon translation was done by {Qov:n:name}. The English comes from the subtitles, with punctuation edited for clarity.

table.name: mem
table.column: 願我們繼續是克林崗人！
This literally means "We are Klingon, may it continue". The English subtitles render this as "Remain Klingon!"
Dies bedeutet wörtlich "Wir sind Klingonen, möge es weitergehen". Die deutschen Untertitel zeigen dies als "Wir bleiben Klingonen!"

The line was deliberately translated this way as it was believed that audiences would recognise the embedded {tlhIngan maH!:sen:nolink}
This can also be interpreted as {tlhIngan maHtaHjaj!:sen@@tlhIngan:n, maH:n:1h, -taH:v, -jaj:v}, "May we continue to be Klingon". This technically violates the rule that a Type 7 suffix cannot be used with {-jaj:v} (see note under that entry), but this rule was later explained to have exceptions that would've made this sentence acceptable.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ما به دنبال چه کسی هستیم؟ [AUTOTRANSLATED]

These lines were not given a name within the show, but some have referred to it online as "the Kahless prayer" or "the prayer to Kahless".
Even though the line spoken by {tIquvma:n:name} means "Give me light to go", it was still subtitled in English as "Give us light to see". This is probably a production error.
[1] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}, [2] {DSC - Despite Yourself:src}, [3] {DSC - The Wolf Inside:src}

This is written as "Qich'lut" in the book. It is in a form of {no' Hol:n}.

table.column: She is the actress who plays {lurSa':n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: It is also possible to say {mIyama Hol:n@@mIyama:n, Hol:n}.[2]

The expression "[{bama:sen:nolink}/{mIyanma:sen:nolink}] {Hol:sen:nolink}" was used by MO on Facebook in a message dated Feb. 11, 2014.[1] The spelling "{mIyama:sen:nolink}" (note the dropped {n:sen:nolink}) was subsequently revealed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.[2]
The reason that the language is {bama Hol:n:nolink} while the country is {mIyama:n:nolink} has to do with disputes about the name of the country in the early 21st century.

table.column: Both this term and {Hanghuq:n:place,nolink} are used. Klingons are very confused by this.[1]
"Chosŏn" is the name used for (unified) Korea in North Korea and by ethnic Koreans living in China and Japan.

table.name: mem

Dies ist der Name mehrerer stillgelegter terranischer Währungen.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the Terran retelling of {Hamlet:src}, the titular character is the prince of this country on Earth.
In der terranischen Nacherzählung von {Hamlet:src} ist der Titelcharakter der Prinz dieses Landes auf der Erde.
В земном пересказе {Hamlet:src}, главный персонаж является принцем этой страны на Земле.

table.name: mem
table.column: Here, {DIvI':n} has its generic sense of "association" (as in "association football", the formal name of "soccer"), rather than referring to "the Federation" ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Its capital city is {berlIn:n}. Another large city is {Hamburgh:n}. The {qepHom'a':n} takes place in {Sarbruqen:n}.
Die Hauptstadt ist {berlIn:n}. Eine andere große Stadt ist {Hamburgh:n}. Das {qepHom'a':n} findet in {Sarbruqen:n} statt.

Marc Okrand provided a Klingon name for {Klingon Monopoly:src} in case it was ever needed, but it ended up never being used in the product itself nor in any marketing.

The definition uses the spelling from Lewis Carroll's "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland", because it was requested to translate that book, but this is more commonly spelled as "griffin" (or sometimes "griffon") in English.

The Las Vegas Hilton hotel was the site of a themed attraction called Star Trek The Experience. The name of the city appeared in Klingon in the invitation to the grand opening.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the name of a Terran holiday.
There is no traditional Klingon way to say something like "Merry Christmas". An expression such as {wornagh yItlhutlh!} might be more appropriate.[1]

Это название земного праздника.
Не существует традиционного способ сказать что-то типа "Счастливого рождества". Выражение типа {wornagh yItlhutlh!} может быть наиболее соответствующим для этого.[1]
Maltz thought "Merry Christmas" and "Happy New Year" were silly things to say.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: eräs Shex'pirin näytelmä, Khamlet; eräs Shex'pirin näytelmän hahmo, Khamlet
This is the name of a famous play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, and also the name of its eponymous protagonist.
Dies ist der Name eines bekannten Stücks von {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, als auch dessen Hauptfigur.
Название известной пьесы, автором которой является {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, а также имя одноименного протагониста.
This is written as "Khamlet" in the introductory text of {Hamlet:src}, but as "Hamlet" in the English side of the play itself.

table.name: mem
table.column: His original Klingon name was never spoken in {Star Trek VI:src}, where he was only referred to as "Shakespeare".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a famous Klingon playwright.

table.name: mem
table.column: eräs Shex'pirin näytelmän hahmo, Yulyush Kayshar
This is the name of a play by {wIlyam SeQpIr:n:name}, and also the name of its titular character, a legendary Romulan leader.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a form of ritualistic torture performed by Klingon women on prisoners of war.

This word and {norgh:n} first appeared in the novel {Sarek:src} by A. C. Crispin. Three years later, {norgh:n:nolink} appeared in {KGT:src}, but {be'joy':n:nolink} was left out, possibly to keep the book "family-friendly".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is said during the ritual of discommendation ({naDHa'ghach:n}). The usual way to say "coward" is {nuch:n}.

According to the script for {TNG - Sins of the Father:src}, Worf says {tlhIH ghIj jIHyoj:sen@@tlhIH:n, ghIj:v, jIH:n:1, yoj:n}, which is not grammatical, but is supposed to mean "I fear your judgment". K'mpec then replies with {bIHnuch:sen:nolink}. It is reasonable to assume that these two phrases are archaic and ritualised.
It's likely that these sentences were made up by a writer who consulted {TKD:src}, as they contain existing words, but did not have an understanding of Klingon grammar.

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal (makes bleating sounds and tends to run around in circles)
type d'animal (fait des bêlements et a tendance à courir en rond) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
According to the glossary to {Honor Bound:src}, this is an animal native to {bo'retlh:n}, which makes bleating sounds and tends to run around in circles.
This is closer to a hyena than a sheep, according to a {@KRADeC tweet 2012.07.02:src}.

{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Klingon Language Assistant" - database version [[VERSION]].
To begin searching, simply press the "Search" (magnifying glass) button and type into the search box.
To hear the sounds of Klingon, you need to install a {Text-To-Speech engine:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine}.
To chat with other Klingon speakers, join the {KLI Discord server:url:https://www.kli.org/activities/discord/}.
To make it easier to type Klingon on a mobile keyboard, the following shorthand (called "xifan hol") can be enabled under the Preferences menu: c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} / i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink} It is also possible to choose the alternate keymapping: k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}
If you encounter any problems, or have any suggestions, please send me an {email at De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.
Please support the Klingon language by purchasing {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, and other Klingon- and Star Trek-related products from Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, and Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.
Klingon, Star Trek, and related marks are trademarks of CBS Studios, Inc., and are used under "fair use" guidelines.

Litaer) Swedish translations: {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/} Russian translations: Кирилл Шилов, Дэниел Дэдеп and Sirglin (Ольга Косарева) Portuguese translations: Thiago Matos Finnish translations: Iikka Hauhio TNG {pIqaD:n} font: Admiral {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} of the {Klingon Assault Group:url:http://www.kag.org/} DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} font: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Lieven L. Litaer)
Special thanks to Marc Okrand ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) for creating the Klingon language.

{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Klingonisch-Assistent" - Datenbank Version [[VERSION]].
Um eine Suche zu starten, Klicke auf das Suchsymbol (die Lupe) und gib etwas in das Suchfeld ein.
Um die klingonischen Wörter zu hören, muss die {Vorlesesoftware:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine} installiert werden.
Um dich mit anderen Klingonisch-Sprechern auszutauschen, besuche den {KLI Discord-Server:url:https://www.kli.org/activities/discord/}.
Um auf einer kleinen Tastatur einfacher Klingonisch einzugeben, kann in den Einstellungen die folgende vereinfachte Eingabemethode ("xifan hol" genannt) aktiviert werden: c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} / i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink} Zusätzlich kann auch die folgende Tastenbelegung ausgewählt werden: k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}
Bei Problemen oder Vorschlägen, sende bitte eine {E-Mail an De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.
Bitte unterstütze die klingonische Sprache durch den Erwerb der Bücher {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, sowie der anderen Klingonen- oder Star-Trek-bezogenen Produkte von Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, und Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.

{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Помощник по Клингонскому языку" - версия базы данных [[VERSION]].
Чтобы начать поиски, просто нажмите кнопку "Поиск" (увеличительное стекло) и печатайте в строке поиска
Чтобы услышать звуки на Клингонском языке, вам необходимо установить {Text-To-Speech engine:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine}
Для общения с другими изучающими клингонский присоединяйтесь к {KLI Discord server:url:https://www.kli.org/activities/discord/} серверу.
Чтобы облегчить процесс печати текста на клингонском на мобильной клавиатуре, стеганография (под названием "xifan hol") может быть активирована в меню Preferences: c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} / i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink} Также возможно использовать альтернативную раскладку: k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}
Если вы столкнетесь с какими-либо проблемами, или у вас появятся предложения, пожалуйста отправьте сообщение на {email at De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.
Поддержите Клингонский язык, купив {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, и другую продукцию, связанную со Стар Трэком и Клингонами , от Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, and Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.
Клингонский язык, Стар Трек, и связанные марки и торговые марки CBS Studios, Inc., использованы согласно рекомендациям доктрины "Добросовестного использования".
Программирование под Android: {De'vID:n:name} Flutter (iOS) port: Daniel Dadap Клингоно-агнглийская информация: {De'vID:n:name,nolink}, с помощью других Переводы на немецкий язык: {Quvar:n:name} (Ливен Л. Литар) Переводы на шведский язык: {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/} Переводы на русский язык: Кирилл Шилов ({tlhIngan:n:name,nolink} в KLI и {qrell:n:name,nolink} в Klingon Assault Group), Дэниел Дэдеп и Sirglin (Ольга Косарева) Переводы на Португальский язык: Thiago Matos Переводы на Финский язык: Iikka Hauhio TNG {pIqaD:n} font: Адмирал {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} из {Клингонской штурмовой группы:url:http://www.kag.org/} DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} font: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Ливен Л. Литар)
Особая благодарность Марку Окранду ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) за создание Клингонского языка.

{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Assistente Klingon" - versão do banco de dados [[VERSION]].
Para começar a pesquisar, basta pressionar o botão "Pesquisar" (lupa) e digitar na caixa de pesquisa.
Para ouvir os sons do Klingon, você precisa instalar um {leitor de texto:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine}.
Para conversar com outrass pessoas que falam Klingon, junte-se ao {servidor do KLI no Discord:url:https://www.kli.org/activities/discord/}.
Para tornar mais fácil digitar Klingon em um teclado móvel, a seguinte forma abreviada (chamada "xifan hol") pode ser ativada no menu Preferências: c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} / i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink} Também é possível escolher o mapeamento de teclado alternativo: k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}
Se você encontrar algum problema ou tiver alguma sugestão, envie-me um {email para De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.
Por favor, apóie o idioma Klingon comprando {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src}, e outros produtos Klingon e Star Trek de Pocket Books, Simon & Schuster, e Paramount/Viacom/CBS Entertainment.
Klingon, Star Trek e marcas relacionadas são marcas comerciais da CBS Studios, Inc. e são usadas de acordo com as diretrizes de "uso justo".
Programação Android : {De'vID:n:name} Porte Flutter para (iOS) : Daniel Dadap Dados Klingon-English : {De'vID:n:name,nolink}, com ajuda de outros Tradução Alemã : {Quvar:n:name} (Lieven L. Litaer) Tradução Sueca : {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/} Tradução Russa : Кирилл Шилов, Дэниел Дэдеп and Sirglin (Ольга Косарева) Tradução Portuguesa : Thiago Matos Tradução Finlandesa : Iikka Hauhio TNG {pIqaD:n} fonte: Almirante {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} do {Klingon Assault Group:url:http://www.kag.org/} DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} fonte: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Lieven L. Litaer)
Agradecimentos especiais para Marc Okrand ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) por criar a Língua Klingon.

{tlhIngan Hol boQwI':n:nolink} "Klingonin kieliavustaja" - tietokantaversio [[VERSION]].
Sanoja voi hakea painamalla "Hae"-nappia (suurennuslasia) ja kirjoittamalla hakusanan tekstikenttään.
Sanojen ääntämyksen voi kuunnella erikseen ladattavalla {puhesyntetisaattorilla:url:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.tlhInganHol.android.klingonttsengine}.
Jos haluat keskustella muiden klingoninpuhujien kanssa, tule KLI:n {Discord-palvelimelle:url:https://www.kli.org/activities/discord/}.
Toinen vaihtoehto on ottaa käyttöön alla olevat korvaukset (ns. "xifan hol") asetusvalikossa: c ▶ {ch:sen:nolink} / d ▶ {D:sen:nolink} / f ▶ {ng:sen:nolink} / g ▶ {gh:sen:nolink} / h ▶ {H:sen:nolink} / i ▶ {I:sen:nolink} / k ▶ {Q:sen:nolink} / s ▶ {S:sen:nolink} / x ▶ {tlh:sen:nolink} / z ▶ {':sen:nolink} On myös toinen versio, missä q ja k on vaihdettu: k ▶ {q:sen:nolink} / q ▶ {Q:sen:nolink}
Jos sinulla on ongelmia, ota yhteys ohjelman tekijään sähköpostitse osoitteeseen {De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com:url:mailto:De.vID.jonpIn@gmail.com?subject=boQwI%27%20feedback&body=Device:%20%0D%0AAndroid%20version:%20%0D%0A}.
Tue klingonin kielen kehitystä ostamalla {The Klingon Dictionary:src}, {Klingon for the Galactic Traveler:src}, {The Klingon Way:src}, {Conversational Klingon:src}, {Power Klingon:src} ja muita klingoniin tai Star Trekiin liittyviä tuotteita Pocket Booksilta, Simon & Schusterilta ja Paramountilta/Viacomilta/CBS Entertainmentilta.
Klingon, Star Trek ja liittyvät sanat ovat CVS Studios, Inc. -yhtiön tavaramerkkejä ja niitä käytetään "fair use" -doktriinin mukaisesti.
Android-ohjelma: {De'vID:n:name} Flutter (iOS) -versio: Daniel Dadap Klingon-englanti-sanakirja: {De'vID:n:name,nolink}, muiden tuella Saksankielinen käännös: {Quvar:n:name} (Lieven L. Litaer) Ruotsinkielinen käännös: {Klingonska Akademien:url:http://klingonska.org/} Venäjänkielinen käännös: Кирилл Шилов, Дэниел Дэдеп ja Sirglin (Ольга Косарева) Portugalinkielinen käännös: Thiago Matos Suomenkielinen käännös: Iikka Hauhio TNG {pIqaD:n} -fontti: amiraali {qurgh lungqIj:n:name,nolink} {Klingon Assault Groupista:url:http://www.kag.org/} DSC {pIqaD:n:nolink} -fontti: {Quvar:n:name,nolink} (Lieven L. Litaer)
Erityiset kiitokset Marc Okrandille ({marq 'oqranD:n:name}) klingonin kielen luomisesta.

table.column: This element is not known to exist as a word, but appears as a component of {bo'DIj:n} and {ghIpDIj:v}. Its homophony to {DIj:v:1} suggests that it describes two parties pitted against one another.

table.column: بنفش ، بنفش (در کلینگون استفاده نمی شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
紫色，紫色（在克林崗州不使用） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Neither {SuD:v:1} nor {Doq:v} includes what is called "violet" or "purple". This may be related to Klingon physiology.[2]

Despite the statement in {KGT:src} that "violet" and "purple" are not covered by the Klingon colour words, it was nevertheless included in {TNK:src} as that software follows a fixed template which required a translation to label such a colour.

table.name: mem
table.column: It's likely that {Do':n:2,archaic,hyp,nolink} is an archaic word for the modern {Duj:n:1}.[1] This conjecture is supported by {'ejDo':n} and {Delaq Do':excl}.

Using {SeH:n:nolink} as an independent word (as a noun) felt weird to him (but he's changed his mind before).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word appears on {KGT p.132:src}, but based on the context it is clearly a typo for {bIt:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The symbol of the Klingon Empire (the imperial trefoil) is said to be called the "Heart of Virtue", or {tIq'ghob:n:nolink} "in the ancient tongue" (see {no' Hol:n}), by General Chang ({cheng:n:name}). In modern standard Klingon, "Heart of Virtue" would be {ghob tIq:n:nolink}. The two words are transposed in the manner of {paq'batlh:n}.
The three arms of the {tIq'ghob:n:nolink} are said to represent honor, loyalty, and duty.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Klingon board game played with dice. Its name means "obliterate them".[1]

This game was named after {DSC:src} graphic designer Andy Tsang. By coincidence, {tISang:n:nolink} happens to have an appropriate meaning in Klingon. This meaning was mentioned in the episode in which it appears.

Ihr seid in die Zuständigkeit des klingonischen Imperium eingetreten.
شما قضیه امپراتوری کلینگان را وارد کرده اید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du har gått in i Klingon-rikets jurisdiktion. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы вошли в юрисдикцию империи клингонов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你們已進入了克林崗帝國的管轄範圍。
Você entrou na jurisdição do Império Klingon.
Olette saapuneet Klingonien keisarikunnan tuomiovallan alueelle.
Vous êtes entré dans la juridiction de l'Empire Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a concept in computer programming, namely, a segment of code which is repeatedly executed until some condition is met.

This was used in Klingon Blockly. Marc Okrand was shown a list of terms and their translations, and commented that Maltz said that some of them were the correct terminology used by Klingons. However, it isn't clear which ones.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Since this is not a grammatical sentence, one can only assume that it is in some form of {no' Hol:n}. It is recommended to say {Qapla'!:sen} or {povjaj!:excl} instead.

This ungrammatical expression appears on the back cover of {How to Speak Klingon:src}, where it is translated as "Good luck".[1] Even though the sentences inside this book were provide by the Klingon Language Institute (see {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}) and use proper grammar, it seems that whoever designed the cover just copied this erroneous expression from the Internet without verifying it with a competent speaker. The originator of this expression is unknown but it appeared on some fan websites in 2011, where it is claimed that it literally means "Go with fortune".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used in the {ma'to'vor:n} ritual. It must be real and not replicated.[1]
[1] {DS9 - Sons of Mogh:src}, [2] {A Good Day to Die:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: be landed? be in the air? (aircraft)
être débarqué ? être dans les airs ? (avion) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is an unknown element found in {'eDSeHcha:n}. Following the example of {lolSeHcha:n}, this should be a verb related to aircraft landing or take-off. Perhaps it is the same word as {'eD:v:1} and taking off or landing is somehow related to crawling in the Klingon way of thinking.

table.name: mem
table.column: This element is known only from {'ejDo':n} and {'ejyo':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Terran name used in the Duolingo Klingon course.

table.name: mem
table.column: The word {'ISletlh:n:hyp,nolink} has never appeared by itself, but is found in {yan 'ISletlh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: She is the translator of the Tao Te Ching and Sunzi's Art of War into Klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: Sistema de escrita não linear Unker [AUTOTRANSLATED]
